pageContext.claim: “Hundreds upon hundreds of people from outside our country have been convicted of terrorism-related offenses in the United States courts.”
pageContext.analysis: Of about 400 individuals charged with or credibly involved in jihad-inspired activity in the U.S. since 9/11, just under half (197) were U.S.-born citizens, according to research by the nonpartisan think tank New America Foundation. An additional 82 were naturalized citizens, and 44 were permanent residents.
